Detailed Description

Interface of APS Entity Authentication Services.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com

Definition in file apsmeAuthenticate.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum APS_AuthenticateStatus_t

The APS-layer provides services that allow two devices to mutually authenticate each other. The process authenticates the originator of the data by using a random challenge with a response based on a pre-shared secret, in this case, a key. It also allows optional authenticated data transfer. See ZigBee Specification r19, 4.4.8, page 470. Type of entity authentication status code.

Enumerator:
APS_AUTH_SUCCESS_STATUS 

No errors occur.

APS_AUTH_INVALID_PARAMETER_STATUS 

An invalid parameter was input to one of the key establishment primitives.

APS_AUTH_NO_KEY_STATUS 

No authentication key exists.

APS_AUTH_NO_DATA_STATUS 

No authentication data exists.

APS_AUTH_INVALID_CHALLENGE_STATUS 

Challenge is invalid:

  • Initiator during action step 2 (sub-clause B.8.1 of ZigBee Spec r19),
  • Responder during action step 1 (sub-clause B.8.2).
APS_AUTH_INVALID_MAC_STATUS 

MAC transformation outputs invalid:

  • Initiator during action step 4 (sub-clause B.8.1),
  • Responder during action steps 4 and 7 (sub-clause B.8.2).
APS_AUTH_INVALID_KEY_STATUS 

Tag checking transformation outputs invalid:

  • Initiator during action step 3 (sub-clause B.8.1),
  • Responder during action step 6 (sub-clause B.8.2).
APS_AUTH_TIMEOUT_STATUS 

The initiator or responder waits for an expected incoming message for time greater than apsSecurityTimeoutPeriod.

APS_AUTH_NO_SHORT_ADDR_STATUS 

Short address of authentic partner is not found.

Definition at line 44 of file apsmeAuthenticate.h.

enum APS_AuthenticateAction_t

Type of action. See ZigBee Specification r19, Table 4.29.

Enumerator:
APS_INITIATE_ACTION 

Initiate the entity authentication.

APS_RESPOND_ACCEPT_ACTION 

Respond to the entity authentication request, accepting it.

APS_RESPOND_REJECT_ACTION 

Respond to the entity authentication request, rejecting it.

Definition at line 90 of file apsmeAuthenticate.h.

Function Documentation

void APS_AuthenticateReq ( APS_AuthenticateReq_t *const  req)

Initiate or respond an entity authentication.

This primitive can be used when there is a need to authenticate another device without using frame security. The protocol confirms authenticity based on the two devices sharing a pre-shared key. See ZigBee spec r19, 4.4.8.1, page 470.

Parameters:
[in]req- pointer to APSME-AUTHENTICATE.request's parameters.
See also:
APS_AuthenticateReq_t
Returns:
None.
void APS_AuthenticateInd ( APS_AuthenticateInd_t *  ind)

A request to start an entity authentication is received.

See ZigBee Specification r19, 4.4.8.3, page 473.

Parameters:
[in]ind- pointer to APSME-AUTHENTICATE.indication's parameters.
See also:
APS_AuthenticateInd_t
Returns:
